name: Introductory Chemistry
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles of chemistry, including chemical reactions, molecular structure, bonding, and intermolecular forces.

name: Experimental Chemistry
description: This course is a laboratory-based course that provides students with hands-on experience in synthesizing and characterizing materials.

name: Organic Chemistry
description: This course explores the chemistry of carbon-containing compounds, and emphasizes understanding of the relationship between structure and reactivity.

name: Inorganic Chemistry
description: This course explores the chemistry of elements and their compounds, and emphasizes understanding of the relationship between structure and reactivity.

name: Physical Chemistry
description: This course explores the physical principles underlying chemical phenomena, including thermodynamics, quantum chemistry, and kinetics.

name: Materials Chemistry
description: This course introduces students to the synthesis, properties, and applications of advanced materials, including polymers, ceramics, glasses, and composites.

name: Analytical Chemistry
description: This course provides students with a comprehensive understanding of modern analytical techniques, including spectroscopy, chromatography, and electrochemistry, and emphasizes applications to materials chemistry.

name: Advanced Materials Synthesis
description: This course provides students with advanced knowledge of synthetic methods for creating complex materials, and emphasizes development of novel approaches to address current challenges in materials science.

name: Advanced Materials Characterization
description: This course provides students with advanced knowledge of techniques for characterizing materials at the atomic and molecular level, and emphasizes development of novel approaches to address current challenges in materials science.
